author: sahyounk
title: B2B Food Recipes NFT Marketplace
description: Cloud kitchen owners and restaurateurs do not have access to sources of authentic certified recipes with rich metadata and content.

f6_assessments.q0: Appreciate the creativity!  While this proposal does offer a unique B2B/B2C opportunity, I'm still not convinced that the restaurant or cloud kitchen business models would be best served by a blockchain/NFT solution.  I'm also a bit confused how the personas and white labeling ties into your business model.  And regarding NFT minting for recipes, you it would be helpful to have more information about the monetization model you are proposing (i.e. Would creators plan to sell these recipes?  Do they represent ownership?  Would that kind of ownership be enforceable in any way?)
f6_assessments.q1: While I do believe that your unique team experience could help you to overcome your main stated challenge of making a user friendly experience for your non-tech target market, and based on my personal experience with projects like this, I think your team could benefit from more tech talent or a plan on how to deliver tech achievements with an outsourced solution.  Based on the team profiles provided, it seems the UX/UI developer will be carrying a lot of the load on this, and there wasn't enough information to evaluate if the project lead (Karim) has the skills needed to bridge the tech side with the non-tech feedback side - in order to deliver a feedback loop that would make this project meaningful.  And given that this project is mostly in an exploratory phase, I would encourage you to develop it a bit more, then put together a more full proposal that might be able to get you to an MVP stage without the need to double back for small amounts of funding.
f6_assessments.q2: While the timeline and budgets proposed for this project are still a bit conceptual, it might be possible to audit this project if they use the open source repository linked to the proposal.  However, since most of the deliverables for this project are still early phase design and concept oriented, there could be some challenges in evaluating the "readiness" or this project for follow-on funding or continued development work unless those reviewers are knowledgable in the competitive landscape of this specific type of business operation.

f6_assessments.q0: This is an interesting, unique and fun idea to integrate the F&B industries and "foodies" into the blockchain economy and closely fits the challenge setting by bringing extensive experience in the business area proposed in to the Cardano blockchain. Usability both B2C and B2B should be possible with this project, and the main components of a successful business solution like delivery and marketing channels are presented. The whole proposal is unfortunately quite brief and lacks some of the information mentioned in the Community Advisor Assessment Guide such as discussion of key metrics of the challenge setting and how they would align with the project's. Also, no mention of scalability is made and reference to risks under the Impact section of the proposal is made only to UX/UI and not the technological aspects of the blockchain, the business environment, economic climate, trends and other desirable information.
f6_assessments.q1:
No timeline is given and the team's profiles are also lacking references to verify or understand more fully whether relevant skills exist. The proposal is said to be carried out in 3 parts, but no dates or periods are provided to support the feasibility of the planning. 
The only external link given with the proposal is an empty Github repository belonging to a not very active Github user.
From this information, or better lack thereof, it is not clear that the proposer is taking this process very seriously and I disagree that from the information given success could be regarded as likely.
f6_assessments.q2: Instead of providing any metrics like quantitative KPIs the proposal limits its very brief Auditability section to "user friendliness" for non-blockchain natives without providing information how this could be measured. Before getting funded, it is already hinted that more monies would be needed from Fund-9 and that is about the only information contained in this section. "Deliverables" are supposed to be uploaded to Github, but this is not elaborated on, so the reader of the proposal has no idea how to judge success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: B2B NFT for food recipes is awesome concept. this looks very effective and achievable. The Intellectual property for the recipes are essential. Chef and cooks can make very much use this NFT on their recipe in order to monetise it. The problem statement clearly address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The only issue i see is how they are gonna lure the user base going forward, i don't see any strategy on this regard and also this proposal lacks depth and feasibility is not unto the mark  If the team able sort this out. it can be successfully implemented
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability info provided from the proposer is not enough. It can be little detailed. I see lack of KPI points in this. Although the problem statement is very reasonable and use case is effective. the execution lacks depth and it should be carefully looked into.

f6_assessments.q0: This project would help better the existing food industry by utilizing the blockchain, making the industry overall more effective. In my opinion this is a very effective tool that would benefit both the NFT owner as well as the end user. It seems that the challenge would be creating an effective user interface on the back end as well as the front end for the users.
f6_assessments.q1: It appears evident that the project head has experience within this market. The division of steps listed in the "plan timeline" seems feasible to implement well. It would be interesting to see the ideas for the future proposals mentioned for Fund9.
f6_assessments.q2: As the proposal mentions, the deliverables will be uploaded to the community to verify. This idea is an ideal way to audit the progress and the success of the proposal to see how and when the elements are completed.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal wants to create a B2B NFT marketplace for recipes, food videos, menus ... making it available to end users, while the content creators with experience easily join the blockchain network.
With the use of digital content products and minting NFTs which will then distributed on the marketplace, the solution helps these digital assets owners to make money. This is a very good idea. A successfully implementation can be case-study for many other jobs.
This proposal fits the challenge. It makes easier for more people to access blockchain products through solutions like these.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal is an initial plan of the NFT marketplace project. The proposal is presented in clear manner.
The proposer has experience in kitchen management and digital transformation. However, I think he needs to look for more experts in building a blockchain-based system for the next stage.
The first phase of the project is mainly about building business models, writing customer flows and researching user interfaces, etc., so the requested fund is appropriate.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides a research roadmap and is presented on a monthly basis for reviewers to easily check the performance. I’d like to see project roadmap, timeline with specific outcomes.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe this proposal presented a highly applicable project that aims to lift the barriers many cloud kitchen owners and restaurateurs have. However, besides implementing Cardano NFT Marketplace, which is of prime importance in this challenge in Fund 8, I hardly see any competitive advantages of this proposal compared to many similar platforms available now. I may be able to assess the effectiveness of this proposal if more details into their competitive advantages are provided.
f6_assessments.q1: Yes, I believe the 28 years of experience in the cloud kitchen of the proposal maker is excellent for this proposal to be implemented successfully. I just hope that I can see more of the technical aspect from the proposer so that I can assess his/her experience in building and running a successful interface.
f6_assessments.q2: There are two more aspects that I need more information on in this proposal. First, I want more details on the technical aspects of this interface. Does this website/app have any distinctive qualities that set it apart from other competitors in the market? Besides UI UX, what other tools that developers for this interface will use? Second, what is the marketing strategy that the proposer will adopt for this project? What is the money allocated for marketing and educating the potential users? These are the aspects that the proposer might want to think of when tailoring his/her proposal for Fund 9.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal makes no attempt to justify the use of NFTs for recipes. What's the advantage of mintint recipes? The Cardano NFT model is quite different to those of other chains, how does it fit the bussiness model? 
The proposer might want to explore some of these topics with the funds in this proposal, but I think even some bare idea of how Blockchain and Cardano fits in the plan is needed to launch a proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
The aims of this proposal are quite exploratory in nature. The first two deliverables could be what is normally presented as a Catalyst proposal: an idea of who would use the service, and how the service might run. The only clear deliverable is the third item: UX designs.
The proposal mentions that their intention is to partner with an existing CNFT platform. It seems quite a central point of the proposal,  but the roadmap does not include any plans to contact one, discuss integrations, etc. 
The proposal lists three profiles it needs to complete the deliverables, but name just the project lead, that do not claim to fit any of the profiles. Is the plan to find the people after the project is funded? If already identified, they should be listed in the proposal, along with their skills. There is a second proposer listed in Ideascale, that is not mentioned in the proposal. What is her role?
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer plans to use a github repository to openly share project deliverables with a permissive license ("for the community to verify and to use as they see fit"),  and has even set it up already.
This is notable, considering deliverables amount to a business plan.

solution: The project is to connect recipe owners with restaurants and digital cloud kitchens who want to purchase their concepts, recipes and content
experience: The proposer of this idea has 28 years of experience as an amateur chef, in cloud kitchen management, and extensive experience as a digital transformation consultant and change manager. A entrepreneur and consultant, he has helped businesses and governments harness of digital.
